data.title: photodynam: Photodynamical code for fitting the light curves of multiple body systems
data.name: photodynam
data.description: Photodynamical code for fitting the light curves of multiple body systems written by Josh Carter

evidence: "This code was written by Josh Carter ... and the public release is maintained—with the permission of the original author—by Dan Foreman-Mackey. Any questions should be raised as issues on the GitHub repository" (indicates individual maintainers, not an institution or community project).

"photodynam.cpp: User-end code to produce light curves and other information for a standardized input format. Easy to use, probably a good starting point to get some light curves produced." (describes an end-user program for scientific modeling).

"The code included in this package facilitates so-called 'photometric-dynamical' modeling. ... A N-body code provides coordinates and the photometric code produces light curves based on coordinates." and "Run: ./photodynam examples/kepler16_input.txt examples/kepler16_report.txt" (shows it directly produces scientific light curves and is run from the checked-out source).
